intro: Haenianthus salicifolius, commonly known as the willow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and slender, willow-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of Mediterranean flora.
